file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-22-03-04 - OVERHEAD BIN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL OVERHEAD BIN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the overhead bin assemblies. B. The overhead bin assemblies are installed in the passenger cabin, at zones 234, 244, 254, and 264. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-22-03-000-801-A OVERHEAD BIN - REMOVAL ALL 25-22-03-400-801-A OVERHEAD BIN - INSTALLATION ALL 25-22-03-040-801-A OVERHEAD BIN - DEACTIVATION ALL 25-22-03-440-801-A OVERHEAD BIN - REACTIVATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-22-03 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-22-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. OVERHEAD BIN - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the overhead bins. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the ceiling panel in front of the overhead bin that you need to remove (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (2) Remove the emergency equipment from the last or first overhead bin module, if applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) For overhead bin with plug-in shroud, do these steps: (a) Remove the shrouds (1) to have access to the ceiling fittings (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Hold up the front of the overhead bin assembly (6) and remove the bolts (5) and the washers (4) that attach the overhead bin assembly (6) to the ceiling fittings (2). (c) Remove the screws (7) that attach the hook assemblies (8) to the rear hanger tube (9). (d) Put the hook assemblies (8) open and remove the overhead bin assembly (6). (2) For overhead bin with fastener-attached shroud, do these steps: (a) Hold up the front of the overhead bin assembly (6) and remove the screws (3) and washers (4) that attach the shroud (1) to the ceiling fittings (2). Refer to DET. B. (b) Remove the screws (7) that attach the hook assemblies (8) to the rear hanger tube (9). Refer to DET. C. (c) Put the hook assemblies (8) open and remove the overhead bin assembly (6). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Overhead Bin - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 1 6. OVERHEAD BIN ASSEMBLY B C B A ZONES 234 244 254 264 DET. A 2. CEILING FITTING 1. SHROUD 2. CEILING FITTING 5. SCREW 1. SHROUD 4. WASHER 1 DET. B 3. SCREW 2 DET. B 4. WASHER 1 OVERHEAD BIN WITH PLUG-IN SHROUD. 2 145AMM250046.MCE B OVERHEAD BIN WITH FASTENER-ATTACHED SHROUD. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Overhead Bin - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 2 7. SCREW 10. SHEAR PIN ASSEMBLY 9. REAR HANGER TUBE DET. C 8. HOOK ASSEMBLY 9. REAR HANGER TUBE 10. SHEAR PIN ASSEMBLY SHEAR PIN INSTL 145AMM250047.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 5 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-22-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. OVERHEAD BIN - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the overhead bins. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) For overhead bin with plug-in shroud, do these steps: (a) Close the hook assemblies (8) on the rear hanger tube (9). Make sure that the shear pin assembly (10) is put into the tube hole. (b) Install the screw (7) to attach the hook assemblies (8). (c) Hold up the front of the overhead bin assembly (6) and install the bolts (5) and the washers (4) to attach the front of the overhead bin (6) to the ceiling fittings (2). (d) Install the shrouds (1) to guard the ceiling fittings (2). (2) For overhead bin with fastener-attached shroud, do these steps: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Close the hook assemblies (8) on the rear hanger tube (9). Make sure that the shear pin assembly (10) is put into the tube hole. (b) Install the screw (7) to attach the hook assemblies (8). (c) Hold up the front of the overhead bin assembly (6) and install the screws (3) and washers (4) that attach the shroud (1) to the ceiling fittings (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the removed ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (2) If you removed the emergency equipment from the last or first overhead bin module, install it again. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-22-03-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. OVERHEAD BIN - DEACTIVATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to deactivate the overhead bin. (2) This task refers to item 25-22-00 - Overhead Bin - of the DDPM (3) The aircraft may be dispatched with the Overhead Bin inoperative provided: (a) No unsecured items are carried in the bin(s); (b) Affected door(s) is (are) secured open or closed or removed, and; (c) Affected bin(s) is (are) placarded to prevent its use. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit-RH/Cockpit-LH H. Deactivation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the door is secured open or closed, or remove it. (2) Attach an "INOPERATIVE - DO NOT USE" placard to the Overhead Bin. (3) Make an entry in the aircraft technical logbook to show that you did the deactivation procedure for the Overhead Bin. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-22-03-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. OVERHEAD BIN - REACTIVATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to reactivate the overhead bin. (2) This task refers to item 25-22-00 - Overhead Bin - of the DDPM B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION CEILING PANEL/OVERHEAD BIN DOOR- ADJUST- AMM TASK 25-22-03-800-801-A/500 MENT FIM 25-22-00-810-801-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit-RH/Cockpit-LH I. Reactivation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Do the troubleshooting and the applicable corrective maintenance procedure for the Overhead BinAMM TASK 25-22-03-800-801-A/500, (FIM 25-22-00-810-801-A). (2) Remove an "INOPERATIVE - DO NOT USE" placard to the Overhead Bin. (3) Make an entry in the aircraft technical logbook to show that you did the reactivation procedure for the Overhead Bin. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 25-22-03 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
